page.title: 07Pinley Abbey Farm
page.content: This is a fascinating farm because the buildings are very old; the farm house dates back to the thirteenth century and it was added to in the sixteeth century. The main farmhouse is being restored at the moment. There are some remains of the old chapel which stood here in the twelfth century. The map shows what appears to be a lake on the site; this is really more of a pond and is all that remains of the moat which once surrounded the Abbey. The buildings attract a great deal of interest from historians and visitors to the area. The farm has 120 acres of land which is mostly used for arable crops, cattle and horses. About 40 Arab horses are kept here for breeding purposes. Some are exported to Arabia but not all.
